runs.comm: big appeal first ball as this swings in full into the pads, may have been slipping down leg, indeed was
this has swung in full again, but he is prepared now, makes some room outside leg, opens up and whacks it through midwicket
what a strike, no holding back again, pitched up delivery from Dawlat and he has swung it flat and mighty over deep square leg
Dawlat responds with a slower length ball slanted across the left-hander, who watches it go past
sets himself up couple of feet outside leg, gets down on a knee and eyes deep square with a heave, but this is another slower length ball and slips past outside off
tries to play at the slower length ball now and is beaten, Dawlat bringing the line a lot closer to off
and goes for six first ball, over extra cover, overpitched delivery, outside off, he takes a step forward and lifts it powerfully
that is an edge, loud sound as he looks to cut, but that slips through the keeper's grasp
another shout for leg before, turned down again, he lunged down a big sweep but failed to connect, could have been struck outside the line of off
unbothered by the appeal, he repeats the big sweep and connects properly now, sending it soaring in front of square
four more, point fails to stop it even as he dives, flat delivery outside off, sitting up to be cut, and put away neatly
defended off the front foot to covers
awkwardly pops it to vacant short midwicket, was looking to get forward, this kicked from a shortish length and he jabbed at it
tight line, right on off stump, rising sharply from just back of a length, defended
another one hurries in from short of a length, he is pinned on to the crease and taps it to point
punched on the up to covers
gets a step out and opens the face to guide it on the up, cannot place it past point
back of a length around the line of off stump, forced straight to cover, and that is the first maiden of the tournament
starts with a slower one that foxes the left-hander, who was down on his knee looking to slog it over midwicket, it beats him and bounces just over the stumps
follows with one angled in around the blockhole, he has another heave, forces it away for a single
way outside off, he reaches out and upper cuts weakly, it falls well short of third man
wider now as he looks to get away from the hitting zone of the batsman
he's connected now, pitched up, not a yorker, and he clears front leg to crack it between the bowler and mid on
some hesitation as he nudges a slower length ball to short fine but they scamper through safely in the end
slow and full and wide, he winds up and has a go at it, mistimes it to covers
starts with a yorker just outside off, the ball rolls towards short fine
slowish length ball, he has a slog, hits it down to long on
wow, that has disappeared into the trees beyond the long on boundary, he did not seem to have connected so well, just stayed back on the crease to a length and swung it high up, it kept on travelling
another yorker, right on the stumps, he jabs it down the track
in the blockhole once more, he makes some room and thick edges it to short third man
back of a length, into the right hander, worked in front of square and they push for the second
third man is up, this is a wide length ball, and he has cut it superbly into the gap, between short third and backward point
goes into the pad now with a slower one as he overcorrects for the last ball, and is put away to the right of the man at short fine leg
back of a length now, coming in, tapped off the back foot to covers
lovely stroke, had some width outside off on this length ball, and he has driven it on the up, in the air, with an open face, high over point, some timing there
pressure on the field now as he taps in front of extra cover and runs, fielder runs in, cannot pick up the ball
slow, loop, full outside off, eased to the sweeper in the deep
they keep swinging and connecting, on the knee for one more slog, this fails to beat deep midwicket
full on the stumps, he cannot get under that and pushes it to long off
takes the inner part of the bat as he heaves again, and travels wide of deep midwicket
Afghanistan break through eventually, Mirwais the man, fuller delivery, Faizan has his final heave of the day, leading edge loops tamely to cover
shout for leg before, but it is an inside edge first and lot of inward angle in the length ball too
fullish ball into the pad, worked through midwicket
still fuller, tapped towards midwicket
short, into the right hander, turned to deep midwicket
punched off the back foot to wide long off
too short, and this time he pays for it, Shahzad sets himself up and pulls it comfortably in front of square
fuller, he shuffles across, and works it down to long on
worked to deep square leg off the pad
sharp diving stop at backward point, this was wide and had been cut hard into the ground
way down the leg side, keeper does well to hurry across and take the pace off it
he's holed out to long on, Mirwais the man again, Shahzad has ended up chipping this length ball high in the air, was probably looking for another big hit from back in the crease
takes a big stride out to a length ball some way outside off and steers it wide of third man
length ball around off, pushed back to the bowler
fullish, just outside off, driven through extra cover
paddled off the pad to short fine leg
wants to dab this fine on the off side but misses
angled in, he pushes it with a straight bat and down to long on
tossed up a bit and takes a thick edge to point as he pushes forward
pushes forward, taps it close to the pitch on off and wants the single, non-striker not interested
flat length ball turned in front of square off the back foot
fullish, driven with the slight spin to long on
wants to get under this, and succeeds, comes out just a bit, and lifts it with the spin high over deep midwicket
flat on the pad, whipped to deep square
nudged backward of square leg
skips down the track, nowhere near the pitch of the ball, and gets a leading edge on the off side
goes on the back foot to cut to deep point
fullish ball around off, softly turned to vacant midwicket
this bounced from a length, he was backing away for the cut, but controlled it well to punch to backward point, who dives to stop it
wants to go inside out as he makes some room, almost holes out to wide long off
punched to deep midwicket
short, he opens up and looks for the pull but only manages to spoon the ball towards long on
good length ball around off, pushed back to the bowler
opens the face and runs this length ball to third man
that is sharp work from the keeper, he's taken this rising length ball and whipped off the bails in a flash, but batsman's back foot is grounded in the crease after he misses with his bat-swing
wants to mow this length ball but it bounces more than he expects and he mishits it

another wicket, terrible mix-up, he tapped a short of a good length ball and set off, by the time non-striker reined him in, he was way down the pitch, and had no chance of coming back as bowler reached the ball and fired in the throw to the keeper
in the blockhole, forced to midwicket
shuffles across to off and works it behind square
very full again, he cannot push it past the bowler
manages to push it between the bowler and extra cover to long off
runs it to short third man for a single
low full toss on the pad, turned to midwicket
that is neatly executed, a length ball bouncing just outside off, he walks a long way across and lifts it behind square leg, it carries all the way
four now, overpitched outside off, he's drilled it through extra cover and long off won;t be getting near that
massive strike, huge, he's got under another one, pitched up delivery outside off, right in his zone, puts front foot out and smashes it way over long off, and out of sight
opens the face and taps a back of a length ball behind point
full toss on off, he does not go after it, pushes it with a straight bat, bowler stops it with his boot
overpitched ball mishit in the air, to wide long off
beaten on the cut, not enough width for the shot
goes back in the crease, bends a knee and helps it just over the man at short fine leg
widish outside off, cut away, sweeper does well to run to his left and cut it off
overpitched, into the pad, he is ready bending low for the sweep and cracks it out of the reach of deep square
driven straight to extra cover and they go through for the single
that kicked, from a length, from the line of off, he was back in the crease and got a leading edge, but it did not carry to point
dropped down the leg side by a diving keeper, he wanted to sweep this, could not get hold of it, Shehzad quickly recovered and had a go at the non-striker's, but missed
high full toss, he almost loses balance as he lifts it in front of square, deep square leg has done superbly to grab a high catch on the run to his left, had to time his small jump as it came down
low full toss around off and middle, worked down to long on
beats his swing with a slow full one close to off stump
huge shout for leg before, big fast bowler going down on his knees and imploring, this was full and on the stumps, also seemed to be an inside edge
has a go at a low loopy full toss, mishits it to long off
full, fast and wide, jabbed out to deep point
full and wide again, he tries to reach out again, misses, keeper appeals for caught behind, in vain
takes it on the full and goes straight over the bowler, long on has it covered with a timely dash
faster they come, faster they go, full delivery drilled through the off side, not too far from the sweeper, but no chance for him
high full toss carved out to deep point
slow and full, he backs away and heaves, thick inside edge races down leg fine past the keeper
crashed into the deep extra cover boundary, slower one from back of the hand, he winds up and smears it along the ground

Dawlat uproots middle stump with an inswinging yorker, and pumps his fist, Javed backs away to leg and heaves in vain, they check for the front-foot no-ball, really tight replays, he seems to have just something behind the line
arrives and carves his first ball over wide long off, steps forward, lofts the length ball with plenty of wrist and holds the pose
four more, a full toss lifted cleanly and calmly over extra cover, sweeper tries but it is out of his reach
smashes a full and wide one straight to the sweeper
beaten this time as this length ball bounces past his huge bat-swing
that stayed airborne for so long, was a mishit, but kept climbing, Nabi got under it at the edge of the long off boundary, and made no mistake, made a difficult take look simple
whips and misses, and this rolls off the pad to short fine leg
digs out a yorker down the track, bowler half-stops it with a dive but cannot prevent the single
they make it two off the last ball with a straight hit along the ground, long on runs around but the throw is wild, they would have made it probably anyway
